Potato.Early Blight: Apply fungicide and remove infected leaves. Rotate crops regularly to prevent recurrence. Practice good sanitation in the garden.
Potato.Late Blight: Use fungicide, increase ventilation, and avoid overhead watering. Remove infected plant parts promptly. Ensure proper drainage to prevent water accumulation.
Potato.Healthy: No specific treatment needed, maintain regular care.

Pepper.Pepper bell Bacterial spot: Use copper-based fungicides. Prune infected branches and destroy them.
Pepper.Pepper bell healthy: Maintain regular care and hygiene. Inspect plants regularly for signs of diseases.

Tomato.Tomato Bacterial spot: Remove infected leaves and use copper fungicide. Apply organic sprays like neem oil.
Tomato.Tomato Early blight: Apply fungicides and remove infected plant parts. Mulch to prevent soil splashing.
Tomato.Tomato Late blight: Use copper fungicides and avoid overhead watering. Enhance air circulation by spacing plants properly.
Tomato.Tomato Leaf Mold: Improve air circulation and reduce humidity. Prune affected branches and increase sunlight exposure.
Tomato.Tomato Septoria leaf spot: Remove infected leaves, apply fungicides, and avoid overhead watering. Practice crop rotation to reduce disease pressure.
Tomato.Tomato Spider mites Two spotted spider m: Use miticides and remove affected leaves. Introduce natural predators like ladybugs.
Tomato.Tomato Target Spot: Apply fungicides and remove infected plant parts. Avoid overhead irrigation to minimize moisture on leaves.
Tomato.Tomato Tomato_YellowLeaf Curl Virus: Control whiteflies and apply systemic insecticides. Use reflective mulch to deter whiteflies.
Tomato.Tomato Tomato mosaic virus: No cure. Remove infected plants to prevent spread. Practice strict sanitation to avoid transmission.
Tomato.Tomato healthy: Maintain regular care and hygiene. Promote soil health through organic amendments.
